# import all necesary libraries
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as mpatches
import matplotlib
%matplotlib inline

import seaborn as sns
from plotly import graph_objs as go
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as pgo

import calendar

from IPython.core.display import HTML
def css_styling():
    styles = open("../input/tps-jan-design/style.css", "r").read()
    return HTML(styles)
css_styling()

source.e66a7292: product_sold_df = pd.DataFrame(df.groupby('product')['num_sold'].sum()).reset_index() fig = go.Figure( data=[go.Pie(values=product_sold_df['num_sold'], labels=product_sold_df['product'],hole=.5, marker = {"colors": ['#ffee58', '#ffab91', '#ff7043']}) ]) fig.update_traces(textposition='inside', textinfo='percent+label') fig.update_layout(annotations=[dict(text='Sell of different products in Kaggle store', x=0.5, y=1.2, font_size=20, showarrow=False)],showlegend=False) fig.show()
source.c36cbf1b:
df['date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date'])
df['year'] = df['date'].dt.year

year_store_sell_df = df.groupby(['store', 'year'])['num_sold'].sum().unstack().T.reset_index()
source.d1c007ed:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (12,6), dpi = 80)

ax = sns.barplot(y=year_store_sell_df['KaggleMart'], x=year_store_sell_df['year'],
              palette=['#ffb74b', '#ffd6a4', '#ceb1f2', '#a071ff', '#6f71f7'])

ax1 = ax.twiny()
sns.lineplot(data=year_store_sell_df, marker='o', x='year', y='KaggleMart', color='#3126ff', linewidth = 0.7)

for i in ax.patches:
    ax.text(i.get_x()+0.15, i.get_height()-150000, \
            '{:,d}'.format(int(i.get_height())), fontsize=15,weight='bold',
                color='white')
    
    
plt.title('\nSells in KaggleMart Store from 2015 to 2018\n', size=20, color='grey')
ax.tick_params(axis='x', labelsize=14)
ax.tick_params(axis='y', labelsize=12)
ax.set_xlabel('\nYear\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
ax.set_ylabel('\nNumber of Sell\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
ax.axes.set_ylim(-20000, 1200000)


ax1.axes.xaxis.set_visible(False)
for i in ['top', 'right']:
    ax.spines[i].set_visible(False)
    
for i in ['top', 'right', 'bottom']:
    ax1.spines[i].set_visible(False)

ax.spines['bottom'].set_bounds(0.005, 3)
ax.spines['left'].set_bounds(0, 1200000)

ax = sns.barplot(y=year_store_sell_df['KaggleRama'], x=year_store_sell_df['year'],

for i in ax.patches:
    ax.text(i.get_x()+0.15, i.get_height()-150000, \
            '{:,d}'.format(int(i.get_height())), fontsize=15,weight='bold',
                color='white')
    
    
plt.title('\nSells in KaggleRama Store from 2015 to 2018\n', size=20, color='grey')
ax.tick_params(axis='x', labelsize=14)
ax.tick_params(axis='y', labelsize=12)
ax.set_xlabel('\nYear\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
ax.set_ylabel('\nNumber of Sell\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
ax.axes.set_ylim(-30000, 2000000)


ax1.axes.xaxis.set_visible(False)
for i in ['top', 'right']:
    ax.spines[i].set_visible(False)

source.8ee9e5bb:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (13,5), dpi = 80)

ax=sns.barplot(x='year', y='num_sold', hue='product', data=df, ci=None, palette=['#fcfa5d', '#fab666', '#f68f6a']);

plt.ylim(-10, 700)
plt.title('\nSells of diffrent Kaggle Products from 2015 to 2018\n', size=20, color='grey')
plt.ylabel('\nNumber of Sell\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
plt.xlabel('\nYears\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
plt.xticks(fontsize=13)
plt.yticks(fontsize=12)

for i in ['top', 'right']:
    side = ax.spines[i]
    side.set_visible(False)
    
ax.set_axisbelow(True)
ax.spines['bottom'].set_bounds(0.005, 3)
ax.spines['left'].set_bounds(0, 700)
ax.legend(prop={'size': 10}, loc='best', fancybox = True, title="Kaggle Product", title_fontsize=12, edgecolor='white');

source.fbcaf912:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (12.5,4), dpi = 80)

ax = sns.lineplot(x="date", y="num_sold", data=df, hue="store", err_style=None, linewidth=1,
                 palette=['#984aff', '#fc956d']);

total_sell = list(df.groupby('store')['num_sold'].sum())

plt.ylim(-100, 1400)
plt.title('\nSell in Kaggle store over the time (2015-2018)\n', size=20, color='grey')
plt.ylabel('\nNumber of Sell\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
plt.yticks(fontsize=10)

for i in ['top', 'right']:
    side = ax.spines[i]
    side.set_visible(False)
    
ax.set_axisbelow(True)
ax.spines['left'].set_bounds(0, 1400)

KM = mpatches.Patch(color='#984aff', label='Total Sell in KaggleMart: {:,d}'.format(total_sell[0]))
KR = mpatches.Patch(color='#fc956d', label='Total Sell in KaggleRama: {:,d}'.format(total_sell[1]))
ax.legend(handles=[KM, KR], prop={'size': 10}, loc='best', fancybox = True, edgecolor='white');
source.3af4d166:
df['month'] = df['date'].dt.month

month_names = list(calendar.month_name)[1:]

month_store_sell_df = df.groupby(['store', 'month'])['num_sold'].sum().unstack().T.reset_index()
month_store_sell_df.month = month_names
source.cc541d5d:
heatmap2_data = pd.pivot_table(df, values='num_sold', index=['store'], columns='month')
heatmap2_data.columns = month_names

plt.subplots(figsize = (12,4), dpi = 80)
sns.heatmap(heatmap2_data, cmap="YlGnBu");
source.2dfc6316:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (12.5,5), dpi = 80)

ax=sns.barplot(y=month_store_sell_df['KaggleMart'], x=month_store_sell_df['month'], palette='rainbow')
ax1 = ax.twinx()
sns.lineplot(data=month_store_sell_df, marker='o', x='month', y='KaggleMart', color = 'white', alpha = .8)

total = sum(month_store_sell_df['KaggleMart'])
for i in ax.patches:
    ax.text(i.get_x()+0.06, i.get_height()-20000, \
            str(round((i.get_height()*100)/total, 2))+'%', fontsize=11,weight='bold',color='white')

plt.title('\nSell in KaggleMart over the Year (2015-2018)\n', size=20, color='grey')
ax.axes.set_ylim(-10000, 400000)
ax1.axes.set_ylim(-10000, 500000)

ax1.axes.yaxis.set_visible(False)
ax.set_xlabel('\nMonths\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
ax.set_ylabel('\nNumber of Sell\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')

for i in ['top', 'right']:
    ax.spines[i].set_visible(False)
    ax1.spines[i].set_visible(False)

for i in  [ax, ax1]:
    i.spines['bottom'].set_bounds(0.005, 11)
    i.spines['left'].set_bounds(0, 400000)

source.aa1b0d03:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (12.5,5), dpi = 80)

cmap = matplotlib.cm.get_cmap('plasma', 7)   
clrs = [matplotlib.colors.rgb2hex(cmap(i)) for i in range(cmap.N)]

ax=sns.barplot(y=day_store_sell_df['KaggleMart'], x=day_store_sell_df['day'], palette=clrs)
ax1 = ax.twinx()
sns.lineplot(data=day_store_sell_df, marker='o', x='day', y='KaggleMart', color = 'white', alpha = .8)

total = sum(day_store_sell_df['KaggleMart'])
for i in ax.patches:
    ax.text(i.get_x()+0.1, i.get_height()-50000, \
            str(round((i.get_height()*100)/total, 2))+'%', fontsize=15,weight='bold',
                color='white')

plt.title('\nSell in KaggleMart store over the week (2015-2018)\n', size=20, color='grey')
ax.axes.set_ylim(-10000, 700000)
ax1.axes.set_ylim(-10000, 900000)

ax1.axes.yaxis.set_visible(False)
ax.set_xlabel('\nDay of the Week\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')
ax.set_ylabel('\nNumber of Sell\n', fontsize=15, color='grey')

for i in ['top', 'right']:
    ax.spines[i].set_visible(False)
    ax1.spines[i].set_visible(False)

for i in  [ax, ax1]:
    i.spines['bottom'].set_bounds(0.005, 6)
    i.spines['left'].set_bounds(0, 700000)

source.6a214526: Sells of different products in KaggleMart & KaggleRama
source.8d0abfa1:
• OBJECTIVE

  • There are two (fictitious) independent store chains selling Kaggle merchandise that want to become the official outlet for all things Kaggle. This Notebook reveals various aspects of both the store to figure out which of the store chains would have the best sales going forward.

  • Finds more details in the page Tabular Playground Series - Jan 2022
source.8c77525d:
• Insights:
  • 1. From the analysis we came to know that Kaggle Hat is highest (≈54%) sold product in the Kaggle Stores.

  • 2. Kaggle Mug is 2nd highest (≈30%) sold product.

source.52da53c3:
• All Insights
  • 1. From the analysis we came to know that Kaggle Hat is highest (≈54%) sold product in the Kaggle Stores.

  • 2. Kaggle Mug is 2nd highest (≈30%) sold product.

  • 3. From the above figure, we can say that in both Kaggle Stores Kaggle Hat is the best-selling product.

  • 4. From the above figure, we can say that in every country, Kaggle Hat is the best-selling product.

  • 5. From the above figure, we can conclude within 2015 to 2018 among several stores of three countries the KaggleRama Store of Norway has the highest number of product selling.

  • 6. In each country, KaggleRama Store has significantly a greater number of sells compare to KaggleMart Store.

  • 7. From 2015 to 2018 in every year the sale of products has significantly increased in both KaggleRama & KaggleMart Store.

  • 8. From 2015 to 2018, the total sell of products in KaggleRama Store is 6,475,990 which is almost 1.75 times of total sell in KaggleMart Store.

  • 9. From the analysis we came to know that from 2015 to 2018, in the month of December both the stores have highest number of products selling and in September month the sale of the product is lowest compared to other months over the year.

  • 10. From the above two figures we conclude that in weekend days the products are more sold in the kaggle stores compared to weekdays.
